lenders.occupational_info:
My career has been focused on the technology/internet industry.  Currently, I am switching gears and volunteering overseas for at least the next 6 months. 

This November I will be going to Nigeria to volunteer with an organization called IDEA Builders (www.ideabuilders.org).  

IDEA Builders mainly works with women in Rural Nigeria to help set up micro-enterprises.  I will be over there to help work on Partnerships and Fundraising for the organization, and I think that Kiva could play a large role in that.

Please drop me a line if you have any other fundraising idea's, comments or questions.  

My email is gregorygunn@gmail.com.

Thanks!

And it's so easy to let myself get tied up in all that I do not have, and forget that there are so many people all around the world that don't have food or water, or shelter, or even the assurance that they will survive to see the next week. Kiva reminds me that although I do not have a lot, the little that I have to give means a lot to those who have nothing.

lenders.name: PISCO EL PATRON
lenders.loan_because: Courtesy: El Patron
lenders.occupational_info:
Courtesy: El Patron Vineyard
South America, Peru
Pisco, name of the traditional drink and patrimony of Peru, is the symbol of Peruvian pride and nationality.

The Spanish conqueror of the Tahuantisuyo Empire was Francisco Pizarro. He was mean, brave, and illiterate that is to say he didn't know how to read neither to write, not even his own name. He signed with a trembling heading.

Pizarro arrived to Cajamarca on November the 15th 1532. He sent Hernando Pizarro to visit the Inca Atahualpa to his Pultumarca camp. After waiting one night and almost the whole next day, the Inca made his appearance in a bunk of gold, arriving to the center of the triangular square of Cajamarca.

Starting from that moment it took place the conquest of the great Inca Empire. The Inca Atahualpa was executed on July the 26th 1533.

Francisco Pizarro's ambition was overflowing; he was the biggest investor in the conquest of Peru. Pizarro obtained big benefits from the takeover. In 1540 he had 27,000 natives that paid him taxes; productive mines of gold in Cuquiabo and silver in Porco, houses, land, plantations, mills, livestock and slaves. Great fortune that was sent to Spain. Peru was a great business for Pizarro and his siblings. There was an agreement between the Crown and Pizarro. 

He was murdered by the Almagristas on 1541 with a lunge in the throat. Later the Spanish Crown took charge of the government.

 	              Peruvian Pisco - Tradicional Drink
 	
The Spaniards brought grape liquor that with the time was elaborated in Peru.
It was named "pisco", name that has three origins: means a Quechua word that translated to English means "bird". The mud container was called "botija", where pisco was deposited. Pisco, city and name of a town that belongs to the Ica valley, correspond to a very important event. The great Independence leader José de San Martin disembarks in the Paracas bay in Pisco, September 8th, 1820.
The botija was a practical container that used in the elaboration of pisco and then to transport and keep it. In the botija the grape juice was fermented and distilled. Afterwards the pisco is stored in botijas. When the botijas are empty they stowed them face down, until being used again in the next vintage.
All this shows that no other country can copy the Peruvian PISCO
Varié ti Of. Piscos
•	Pisco Quebranta: After vintage, the Quebranta grapes are crushed and pressed. Then, the grape pressing is transferred to casks where fermentation begins. Eight days later, the famous "cachina" is ready. During the third week the must is distilled in stills or alembics. The result is an unequaled Pure Peruvian Pisco, unique in the world.
•	Pisco Acholado: (Half-breed) is the result of the distillation of Quebranta and Italia grapes. Each bottle of Pisco La Botija (750 ml) contains approximately 13 pounds of grapes.
•	Pisco Italia: El Patron’s Pisco Italia is made through a slow process using 100% distilled Italia grape juice. The result is a unique pisco with a great bouquet and an unrivaled flavor.
El Patron has excellent vineyards are situated in the Chincha valley, in the Ica region and are cultivated using the latest techniques. This combination has granted this pisco its world famous quality.
                    When you visit Peru, also visit El Patron’s vineyard.
 	            El Patron´s Pisco Sour's Recipe
 	 3 Glasses of pisco 
 1 ½ Glass of sugar 
 2 Glasses of lemon juice 
 White of an egg 
 Shaken ice 
 Add drops of Amargo Angostura

Preparation: Be prepare the PISCO SOUR only in liquidizer, put the egg white and liquefy once that up some spark add the ice until the middle of glass (this is a secret to get that the drink has a texture very heavy, slowly move it and add the ingredients; but not bitter of Angostura, liquefy until the ice be melt.	 

If it is necessary add some ice water and rectify carefully the quality of a good PISCO SOUR.

Pisco Sour 
posted by Dean Jacobs @ 04:10AM, 6/18/06

Plus Cinnamon! 
Posted by Ian Dubelaar @ 03:58PM, 7/20/06
Yes, the egg white is important for the frothy consistency. Also, these are invariably served with a dash of cinnamon riding jauntily in the centre of the foam.

Posted by jay @ 04:34PM, 7/22/06
Usually is made with sugar syrup as well.
Inca Pisco Sour 
Posted by Marv Toleson @ 01:48PM, 7/25/06
I was introduced to this great cocktail in 1962 when I was in the Army at Ft. Bragg, NC. The bartender at the Gunner's Lodge O Club took it out of his 'book' and made it a featured drink special one week It took off from there in popularity and was a staple and refreshing drink for both men and women while I was there until 1964.

PS: Yes, the bartender did also use egg white, liquid or a powder, to give the drink that little appealing frothy look.
Pisco sour 
posted by felipe @ 12:19AM, 8/19/06
..and you should use syrup instead of sugar... the egg white is usually one for one liter of pisco sour. It is intended to make the "foam".
My favorite drink 
Posted by Joe Light @ 02:49AM, 9/26/06
Your have to try this drink, just try it.
Missing allot of ingredients 
Posted by Johanna Quintana @ 06:49AM, 10/06/06
You are missing egg whites and icing sugar--crucial part of Pisco sour.
What happened to egg white?? 
Posted by Gonzalo @ 07:38AM, 11/12/06
It is not pisco sour if it doesn't have egg white.
Recipe amendment 
Posted by Stephen Burgess @ 02:44PM, 12/01/06
Not true. The Angostura is only added to create a Pisco Piranha. Without Angostura is a Pisco Sour!!!
The Best!! 
Posted by Millie @ 03:58PM, 12/17/06

lenders.name: Karen Ryan
lenders.loan_because: Karen received her first Kiva Gift certificate from her grandson Ben.  We are continuing this account in her memory.
lenders.occupational_info:
Karen was especially interested in loaning to women looking to get their own businesses going.  

We hope continuing her loans will be a small piece of the puzzle of solving a few of the world's problems.  

She loved the beach, gardening, beautiful big trees, the New York Times crossword puzzles, her online games, and a good book.  

Those who loved her knew she was a witch...but a benevolent one.

We almost lost our dear Max last year, due to a very serious illness. He is still undergoing countless surgeries due to complications. We are grateful for the Gift of Life. 

I honor all those men and women all over the World who work hard to make a living and to raise their families. God bless you all, and may our small donations be of help for you somehow. We are all connected in this world.

Baha'u'llah said "Ye are all the fruits of one tree, and the leaves of one branch".

ElectrasMonograms.com  is my online store and a portion of all proceeds from sales funnels right back to KIVA!

lenders.occupational_info: I am retired after teaching in secondary schools for 36 years. In addition to teaching chemistry and math for 18 years in the USA, I taught 18 years overseas in Uganda, Samoa, Peru, the Dominican Republic, and Indonesia.

lenders.name: Natalie
lenders.loan_because: It gives someone a chance to get their business started, yet gives them an incentive to become self-sufficient so they can eventually pay their loans off.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student who is very interested in learning about different cultures, traveling, and lending a helping hand to anyone who needs one. These interests of mine were spurred by a global studies class I took called Teens Around the World.

lenders.name: jamie
lenders.loan_because: To try to make a difference to the business people around the world.  I know a loan can change someone's world.

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.occupational_info: Evaluating insurance for insurance companies

lenders.name: Harville Fam
lenders.loan_because:
"I can do everything through him who gives me strength. Yet it was good of you to share in my troubles. 
Moreover, as you Philippians know, in the early days of your acquaintance with the gospel, when I set out from Macedonia, not one church shared with me in the matter of giving and receiving, except you only; for even when I was in Thessalonica, you sent me aid again and again when I was in need. Not that I am looking for a gift, but I am looking for what may be credited to your account. I have received full payment and even more; I am amply supplied, now that I have received from Epaphroditus the gifts you sent. They are a fragrant offering, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing to God. And my God will meet all your needs according to his glorious riches in Christ Jesus.  To our God and Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen. "
Php 4:13-20

lenders.name: Rob
lenders.loan_because: what goes around, comes around.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm the administrator of a group of people who volunteer in a local hospital.

lenders.name: Jana
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach undergraduate chemistry laboratory classes at a state university

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: I hope to honor my family and give these loans in recognition of our daughters - great young women who give much in their own special way.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in an office,  assisting others to meet our goals.  My tools my faith, brain, heart, hands, computer, printer, telephone, and other office machines.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I want to share my blessings!

lenders.name: Graham
lenders.loan_because: I try to correct the imbalance

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: its the right thing to do

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: My family needs our OWN HOUSE. I have 2 small boys and they need their room and place to run, ride abike or play football.
lenders.occupational_info: Actually I don't have a worj, only in the house (cleaning, cooking and helping my kids)

lenders.name: Wendy
lenders.loan_because: Iwant to help someone in the world who is struggling survive and make a better life for themself and thier family
lenders.occupational_info: I help control the inventory in a factory that makes kitchen and bathroom cabinets

lenders.name: Alaine
lenders.loan_because: I feel good helping others.  I'm very blessed and I feel we as humans all do better when we help one another.

lenders.name: Sylvia
lenders.occupation: I also started my business. Good luck & Love!
